page.title: 07BOLTON PERCY VILLAGE
page.content: { Bolton Percy}is small and quiet;it has more new houses than old.There is a Youth Club and a Cricket Club,and a beck,{"The Foss"}flows through. The 15th C. Church built by Reverend Parker has a Lychgate built by "Mousie Thompson".Beside the church is the recently restored mediaeval Gatehouse. The{Church of England school}was built in 1900.It has 20 pupils,a head teacher & a 9 hours part-time teacher. There is a bus to Colton,Appleton Roebuck and York thrice daily. A small shop/postoffice sells butter, cheese,fruit,vegetables & canned food. Fish,greengrocery,milk,post,papers,oil coal & tea are delivered by roundsmen. A pub{"The Crown Inn"}sells Sam Smith's ales,spirits and bar-food. There are 4 farms in the village and a{Dental Surgery,}the nearest doctor is at Tadcaster or Copmanthorpe.
